name: Tan Kai Min, Russell
headerTaglineThree: Computer Scientist with interests in Combinatorial Hard Problems and anything NP-Complete!

services.title: Software Development
services.description: I am proficient in building applications, with experience in building theoretical and application-based research software.

services.title: Maths Tutoring
services.description: I teach secondary school E.Maths, A.Maths and JC/IP Mathematics (and Further Mathematics).

aboutpara: I am a 4-th Year Undergraduate in Computer Science and Mathematics. I am interested in particular in the following topics: Algorithms, Artificial Intelligence and its applications to Combinatorial Optimisation, SAT Solving and Automated Theorem Proving (Reasoning). I mostly prefer the GOFAI approach (Good Old Fashion A.I).

resume.tagline: ðŸ‘‹  I'm a Year 4 Computer Science and Mathematics Double Degree Student at the National University of Singapore (NUS)
resume.description: I specialise in Artificial Intelligence, Algorithms and Theory and mostly the applied side of Mathematics with interests in combinatorial optimisation.

experiences.position: Algorithm and A.I Intern + Backend Software Intern @ Advanced Remanufacturing Technology Centre (ARTC)
experiences.bullets: Created geo-segmentation algorithms for vehicle routing problems, Explored A.I algorithms to FMCG (Fast Moving Consumer Goods) distribution problem, Assisted in building API infrastructure for the client's data I/O API and experiments and simulations API, Awarded the ASTAR Research Internship Award (ARIA)

experiences.position: Undergraduate Researcher @ NUS School of Computing
experiences.bullets: Worked on accelerating SAT Solver algorithms using FPGAs in the Computer Architecture Group
Worked on Optical Fully Homomorphic Encryption, Further details are confidential

experiences.position: Machine Learning Intern @ DSO National Laboratories
experiences.bullets: Working on using A.I to solve Boolean SAT problems., Due to the nature of the job - further details are not revealed here
Working on building new cryptographic algorithms based on Elliptic Curves, Due to the nature of the job - further details are not revealed here
